question.text:
How many of the following statements are CORRECT?

I. India is one of the 12 megadiversity countries of the world.
II. India has only 8.1 percent of the world's land area.
III. Nearly 45,000 species of animals and twice as many as plants have been recorded from India.
IV. According to May's global estimates, only 22 percent of the total species have been recorded so far.
V. Nature's biological library is burning even before we catalogued the titles of all books stocked there.

solution.text: Biodiversity includes all the flora and fauna on Earth. All the varieties of organisms come under biodiversity. India, a tropical country, is considered one of the richest w.r.t. biodiversity as it is many climatic regions. Even though the land mass is just 2.4% of Earth, 8.1% of the total global species diversity is observed in India.  Robert May, who was the CSO of UK govt., gave estimates on global species diversity and if we are to consider it then only 22 percent of the total species have been recorded and 78% is unknown. Human activities have pushed many species to the brink of extinction. As a metaphor we can say that before we can completely catalogue the stocked books the biological library is burning.
